summary: The Military Helicopter Training Safety Act of 2025 directs the Secretary of Defense to report to Congress on the feasibility of installing traffic alert and collision avoidance systems (TCAS) and automatic dependent surveillance-broadcast (ADS-B) IN capabilities in all military rotary-wing aircraft. The reports, due within 90 days of the Act's enactment, must include cost analyses, assessments of effects on civilian airspace safety, necessary cockpit configuration changes, implications for military operations, and recommendations for alternative systems if the installations are deemed unfeasible.
